sentences.en: "Things are moving ahead."— I found that statement vague and unclear.
sentences.cn: “事情正在取得进展。”——我认为这个说法含糊不清。

sentences.en: A lot of the talk was apparently vague and general.
sentences.cn: 很多话明显是些含糊的泛泛之论。
克里斯托弗的回答故意模棱两可。

sentences.en: He returned only a vague answer.
sentences.cn: 他只给了个含糊的回答.

sentences.en: He was conscious of that vague feeling of irritation again.
sentences.cn: 他再次感到有点儿恼火。

sentences.en: He was vague, however, about just what U.S. forces might actually do.
sentences.cn: 然而，他对美军实际可能采取的行动却闪烁其词。

sentences.en: His eyes were always so vague when he looked at her.
sentences.cn: 他看她的眼神总是那么暧昧。

sentences.en: I won't be put off with such vague promises.
sentences.cn: 这种含糊的诺言是敷衍不了我的.
克里斯托弗先生故意回答得含糊其词。

sentences.en: One must not be vague on matters of principle.
sentences.cn: 在原则问题上不能含糊.

sentences.en: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.cn: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

sentences.en: The ideas seem sketchily developed, the textures thin, the images vague.
sentences.cn: 观点阐述不充分，结构单薄，意象也模糊不清。

sentences.en: The phrasing of the question was vague.
sentences.cn: 在这个问题上措词模糊。

sentences.en: The vague shape of a figure loomed through the mist.
sentences.cn: 薄雾中隐隐出现了一个模糊的人影。

sentences.en: They have only a vague idea of the amount of water available.
sentences.cn: 他们只是大概知道可用水的总量。

sentences.en: You could just see vague blobs of faces.
sentences.cn: 你只能看到些模糊的人脸。

trans.tran_cn: 模糊的，（思想上）不清楚的，（表达或感知）含糊的，暧昧的
trans.tran_en: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean
